intro: Ranunculus musculus, commonly known as the meadow buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring a slender, hairy stem and trifoliate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, often accompanied by numerous stamens and a prominent central pistil. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed areas. Ranunculus musculus is an important plant in ecological studies due to its role in pollination and soil stabilization.
